description:
goinstall: add -rev flag to check out / update a specific revision

This is so that the continuous builder can select specific revisions,
but may be useful for others too.

messages.text:
This seems like a mistake to me, for the reasons Gustavo identified.
If people want one specific version, can't they just cd into the
directory and run the appropriate version control command?

Russ

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg
How does that interact with cases where there are multiple dependencies being recursively fetched? Does it fallback to the default behavior if the tag isn't found (or should it)?
